cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 575 miles SE of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the southwestern Atlantic and slowing as it approaches the North Carolina/South Carolina coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the North Carolina–South Carolina border, in the vicinity of Cape Fear/Wilmington NC

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC (hurricane and storm-surge watches)
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC to Duck NC including Albemarle and Pamlico Sounds (hurricane and storm-surge warnings)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Much of the South and North Carolina coastline, especially from Edisto Beach SC northward to the NC/VA border
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥34 kt) increasingly likely Thursday night; hurricane-force gusts possible Friday depending on final track.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of surge possible in Charleston Harbor and adjacent waterways during high tide if peak surge coincides.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches of rain with locally higher totals could lead to flash and river flooding in the Charleston area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, rip currents, and potential for prolonged power outages and debris-blocking port access routes.
